STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 14, 2025
Lauryn Ritchie
Let's Talk About it Girl's Home III
615 W. Lovell,
Kalamazoo, MI, 49007
Re: License #: CI390403045
SI #: 2025SIC0000356
Dear Lauryn Ritchie:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
427 East Alcott St.
Kalamazoo, MI 49001
(269) 251-2471
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000356
Special Investigation Intake Date: February 4, 2025
License #: CI390403045
Licensee Group Organization: Let's Talk About It CMH Services, PLLC
Licensee Designee: Tonya Moore
Chief Administrator: Lauryn Ritchie
Agency Name: Let's Talk About it Girl's Home III
Agency Address: 615 W. Lovell
Kalamazoo, MI 49007
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/17/2026
Capacity: 14
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
2/6/2025 Phone Interview
2/6/2025 Email Documentation received or sent
2/6/2025 Face to Face Documentation received or sent;
Entrance Conference; Incident
Notification; Special Investigation
Initiation; Interview
2/7/2025 Email Incident Notification
2/7/2025 Email Incident Notification
2/10/2025 Phone Interview
2/10/2025 Email Documentation received or sent
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & R 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section Rule 158. (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow
Description written policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff held youth to keep them from fighting, however staff are not
trained to do physical restraints.
Investigation Administrator 1 was interviewed via phone on 2/6/2025. She
reported observing a video of staff intervening during an
altercation between Youth A and Youth B. She also reported both
staff used physical management techniques that they are not
trained to use. All staff are only trained in verbal de-escalation in
“Safety Care” and to avoid any physical management. She
reported there is a no touch policy for staff, and they are only
allowed to block a youth but not touch the youth.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/6/2025. She reported not being present when the incident took
place but has reviewed the video recording which promoted the
complaint. She also reported staff are trained in “Safety care” but
only in verbal de-escalation and not in physical restraint. The
facility also has a no touch policy and staff are restricted on
touching youth. She observed on the video, Staff 1 and Staff 3
engaging in holding the arms of youth to keep them separated
which is against policy and they are not trained in this technique.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/6/2025.
She reported the incident began when Youth A continued to
antagonize the other youth in the program, especially Youth B.
She also reported staff were trying to verbally de-escalate Youth A
but with minimal success. She reported Youth B came downstairs
and told Youth A “don’t’ argue with me and focus on yourself”. To
this, Youth A said they could fight about it. This occurred in the
kitchen area and Youth B ran to the front stairs and started going
upstairs. She also reported Staff 3 was blocking Youth A from
going after Youth B. Youth B then came back downstairs and Staff
1 blocked Youth B until pushing Youth B against a wall in the
2

dining room. Staff 1 reported grabbing Youth B’s hoodie to keep
Youth B from getting at Youth A. She also reported Youth A
pushed Staff 3 to the ground before Staff 3 was able to push
Youth A to the couch in the living room. She reported not being
trained in physical management and forgot about the no touch
policy because she just wanted to keep Youth A and Youth B from
fighting each other.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/6/2025.
She reported being present but not involved during the altercation
described in the allegations. She also reported Youth A and Youth
B were yelling and challenging each other causing Staff 1 and
Staff 3 to get involved. She reported Staff 1 did not grab Youth B
but was blocking Youth B from getting to Youth A. She also
reported not observing Staff 3 grab Youth A but rather stood in
front of Youth A to keep Youth A from getting to Youth B. Staff 2
left the area and went upstairs with the other youth.
Clinician was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/6/2025. She reported not being present at the time of the
incident but since she was on-call, she received a call about the
situation around 3:00 pm. She also reported speaking to both
Youth A and Youth B on the phone and attempted to de-escalate
them. She reported both Youth A and Youth B informed Clinician
that Youth A and Youth B were triggering each other which was
escalating the situation. She also reported there is an initial safety
plan for Youth B because Youth B has only been in the program
for a week, and they are still learning Youth B’s triggers.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/6/2025. She reported Youth A made a racial remark and Youth
B went upstairs to get away from Youth A. After hearing another
youth become triggered by Youth A, Youth B went back
downstairs. She also reported Youth A triggered Youth B when
making faces at Youth B so Youth B “went off”. She also reported
Youth A made a fighting statement (what are you going to do
about it) so Youth B went to fight Youth A. She reported Staff 1
was standing at the bottom of the stairs and stood in Youth B’s
way. She also reported Youth A pushed Staff 3 and Staff 3 hit his
head on the stairs. This caused Youth B to try harder to get to
Youth A. She reported Staff 1 didn’t grab Youth A but continued
blocking Youth B. Youth B denied Staff 1 grabbed Youth B’s
hoodie during the incident. She also denied Staff 3 grabbed Youth
A but only blocked Youth A to keep Youth A from getting to Youth
B. Youth B reported feeling safe at the facility.
3

Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/6/2025. Youth A reported being annoyed by others and gave no
specific information about who was annoying Youth A. Youth A
also reported Youth B was trying to fight with Youth A without
even talking to Youth A first. Youth A reported Staff 3 was holding
Youth A but could not remember how this was occurring. Youth A
also reported Staff 3 pushed Youth A on the couch and Youth A
got back up and pushed Staff 3. Youth A reported not always
feeling safe at the facility and when asked for details, Youth A
reported staff are always asking Youth A to take accountability for
Youth A’s actions. Youth A also reported not liking to take
accountability for Youth A’s actions.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 2/10/2025. He reported
being present and involved in the incident outlined in the
allegations. He also reported engaging in blocking moves to keep
Youth A (he reported was the aggressor) from getting to Youth B.
He reported the incident began with a verbal altercation between
Youth A and all other youth in the program. He also reported while
using the proximity and body blocking, Youth A continued to push
Staff 3. He reported the blocking moved from the hallway leading
to the back staircase to the front staircase where Youth A pushed
Staff 3 to the ground. Once getting up, Staff 3 pushed Youth A into
the living room ending with Youth A sitting on the couch. He also
reported believing that he had not grabbed Youth A’s arms but just
tried to keep Youth A from fighting with Youth B. He reported not
being trained in any physical management at the facility and being
told by administration about the no touch policy. There was a
meeting after the incident in which the no touch policy was
discussed and processed.
Tour Observation:
A walk through was completed at the facility and the areas the
incident took place in were inspected. There is nothing out of
order in this area nor the facility in general.
Documents Reviewed:
Incident Report dated 2/2/25 @ 7:30 pm for Youth A. This
document outlines in detail the incident reported in the allegations.
Youth A became dysregulated after being asked to complete daily
chores and only escalated after several attempts to verbally de-
escalate Youth A. Youth A is documented as changing the focus
of Youth A’s anger from staff to Youth B. This is documented as
resulting in Youth A and Youth B attempting to fight each other as
evidenced by them both running towards each other. Youth A and
4

Youth B are documented as making verbal threats towards each
other and trying to push against staff standing between Youth A
and Youth B. It is documented Youth A pushed Staff 3 to the
ground, but Staff 3 was still able stay between Youth A and Youth
B. It is documented that Youth A continued to be aggressive
towards Youth B even after Youth B left the building for a walk.
This resulted in Law Enforcement being called to help process
with Youth A.
Let’s Talk About It 3 No Touch policy dated 2/2024. The policy
outlines the facility’s procedure for dealing with youth with
escalated behaviors. The opening line in the policy states “Staff
should not touch youth at any time”. The second line states, “Staff
is to only use verbal de-escalation techniques with an escalated
youth. It is documented staff are to encourage youth to use coping
skills and seek additional support if necessary.
Video Recording:
A review of the video recording capturing the incident outlined in
the allegation was reviewed. The video recording begins with a
view in the kitchen facing the hallway to the backstairs and door
leading outside. Staff 3 is observed walking towards the hallway
facing the hallway when Youth A is observed approaching Staff 3
very quickly. Staff 3 turns and appears to block Youth A from
entering the hallway. Youth A then is observed running through
the house to the front stairs where Staff 3 reaches the stairs
before Youth A. Staff 3 stands in front of Youth A blocking Youth A
from going up the stairs where Youth B is standing. Youth B
attempts to reach Youth A who is still trying to get past Staff 3 and
Staff 1 steps in front of Youth B blocking Youth B from moving
forward. Staff 1 blocks Youth B until Youth B is backed up against
a wall in the dining room. Youth A pushes Staff 3 until Staff 3 falls
but quickly gets back up. Staff 3 blocks/pushes Youth A until
Youth A sits on the couch in the living room.
HR record for Staff 1 was reviewed. Staff 1 was hired on
9/12/24 and is up to date on training. There are no disciplinary
actions documented in her personnel file.
HR record for Staff 2 was reviewed. Staff 2 was hired on
10/15/24 and is up to date on training. There are no disciplinary
actions documented in her personnel file.
5

HR record for Staff 3 was reviewed. Staff 3 was hired on
1/15/25 and is up to date on training. There are no disciplinary
actions documented in her personnel file.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as evidence by interviews
with staff, youth and video recording review. Administrator 1
reported observing Staff 1 and Staff 3 engage in inappropriate
touching/pushing of Youth A and Youth B when trying to keep
them from fighting.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical Assistance was offered to the facility to train all staff
with physical management techniques. This would allow staff to
engage in physical management as a last resort to keep youth
safe.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
2/12/2025
______________________________________
Paul Fatato Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
2/14/2025
________________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
